column4: if you click on it ... that would open it ... then you could tell what it is... try to right click... it should have a name
right click does not give me a name or I would have mentioned it...I am guessing that it is either alsa or pulseaudio settings
are you running Jack.... and if you are have you made any changes to Jack...
Jack audio... a fun mess to play with... and to tell the truth i dont mess with it... cuz i dont know Jack lol
:) well I would put myself in that catagory
that is about the only one that i can think of that would change volume like that... what file format are the movies you are finding this problem with... and is it only movies?
and no matter the file format you are still having this problem?
have you tried a different player such as Gnome Mplayer
yes...it is running fine...sound stops...I change the indicator volume all the way up and then back down and it works fine
have you tried out other players...
